data.title: Former Federal Reserve Vice Chairman: Future Fed voting will continue to show division.
data.description: Former Federal Reserve Vice Chairman Richard Clarida, speaking about internal opposition within the Fed, said: "I'm sure we'll see more of this during the remainder of Powell's term. If you just look at the dot plot, you'll see the committee is quite divided on whether to cut rates now, given that inflation is currently at 3%." (Jinshi)

data.title: The Federal Reserve's interest rate decision saw a divergence of opinions for the first time in many years.
data.description: This Federal Reserve interest rate decision saw a rare "hawkish-doveish" split: Governor Stephen Milan, for the second consecutive meeting, advocated for a more aggressive rate cut, arguing for a 50-basis-point cut instead of the actual 25-basis-point reduction; meanwhile, Kansas City Fed President Schmid took a hawkish stance, opposing any rate cut and advocating for maintaining the current rate. This kind of two-way disagreement last occurred in September 2019, reflecting a significant divergence in the Fed's assessment of the economic outlook. (Jinshi)

data.title: Following the Federal Reserve's interest rate decision, the yield on the 10-year U.S. Treasury note rose by 3.9 basis points.
data.description: Following the Federal Reserve's interest rate decision, US Treasury yields continued to rise, with the 10-year yield increasing by 3.9 basis points to 4.022%. (Jinshi)

data.title: FOMC Statement: Federal Reserve Governor Milan believes a 50 basis point rate cut is warranted.
data.description: FOMC Statement: Federal Reserve Governor Milan dissented from this interest rate decision, believing that a 50 basis point rate cut was warranted. (Jinshi)

data.title: U.S. stocks maintained their upward trend after the Federal Reserve announced its interest rate decision, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average currently up 0.35%.
data.description: Following the Federal Reserve's interest rate decision, the three major U.S. stock indexes maintained their upward trend, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average up 0.35%, the S&P 500 up 0.25%, and the Nasdaq Composite up 0.65%. (Jinshi)

data.description: U.S. short-term interest rate futures fell after the Federal Reserve cut rates, as traders bet on further rate cuts. (Jinshi)

data.title: The US Federal Reserve's interest rate decision on October 29 (upper limit): 4%, expected 4.00%.
data.description: The US Federal Reserve's interest rate decision (upper limit) for October 29th is 4%, compared to an expected 4.00% and a previous value of 4.25%. (Golden Ten)

data.title: The Federal Reserve cut interest rates by 25 basis points as expected
data.description: The Federal Reserve cut its benchmark interest rate by 25 basis points to 3.75%-4.00%, marking its second consecutive rate cut at its meeting, in line with market expectations. (Jinshi)

data.title: Prior to the FOMC statement, a rate cut at this Fed meeting was a foregone conclusion, with an 85.4% probability of another rate cut in December.
data.description: According to CME's "FedWatch": The probability of the Federal Reserve cutting interest rates by 25 basis points in October is 97.8%, while the probability of keeping rates unchanged is 2.2%. The probability of the Fed keeping rates unchanged by December is 0.3%, with a cumulative probability of a 25 basis point rate cut of 14.3% and a cumulative probability of a 50 basis point rate cut of 85.4%. The probability of the Fed keeping rates unchanged by January next year is 0.1%, with a cumulative probability of a 25 basis point rate cut of 7.5%, a cumulative probability of a 50 basis point rate cut of 50%, and a cumulative probability of a 75 basis point rate cut of 41.6%. (Jinshi)
